[Motivational interviewing (see item 1) is an essential tool in addictology.

question.title: What is a key principle of motivational interviewing?
question.description: Motivational interviewing is a technique used in addictions treatment.

option_a.title: Avoidance
option_a.description: The goal of motivational interviewing is to avoid the patient's triggers and emotions.

option_b.title: Empathy
option_b.description: Empathy is a key component of motivational interviewing, as it helps build rapport with the patient.

option_c.title: Confrontation
option_c.description: Motivational interviewing involves directly confronting the patient about their addiction.

option_d.title: Avoiding ambivalence
option_d.description: The primary goal of motivational interviewing is to eliminate ambivalence in the patient.
